applications.name: Google Docs
applications.description: Google Docs is a cloud-based word processing application for creating, editing, and collaborating on documents in real-time. It includes accessibility features like screen reader support, voice typing, and keyboard navigation throughout the interface.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Tab to move to the next cell in the table row or first cell of next row if at end.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cell position such as Row 2 Column 3 and read cell content.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Forward Slash together to search all menu items and commands available in Google Docs.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce search box. Type command name to quickly access any menu item. More efficient than navigating menus.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and A together, release, then press H to open document outline showing heading structure.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce outline panel opened. Navigate document structure by headings. Click heading to jump to that section.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and A together, release, then press C to open comments panel showing all comments.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce comments panel. View, add, resolve, or reply to comments.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and N together, release, then press H to jump to the next heading in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce next heading and read heading text. Efficient navigation for structured documents.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and P together, release, then press H to jump to the previous heading in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous heading. Navigate backward through document structure.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and N together, release, then press C to navigate to the next comment in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce comment and read comment text. Efficient for reviewing feedback.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and P together, release, then press C to navigate to the previous comment.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous comment. Navigate backward through comments.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and H together to open version history showing all document revisions.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce revision history panel. View changes by date and author, restore previous versions.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or cursor positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Control and B together to make selected text bold or toggle bold formatting off if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bold formatting applied or removed depending on verbosity settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and I together to italicize selected text or toggle italic formatting off.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce italic formatting based on verbosity level.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and U together to underline selected text or remove underline if already applied.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce underline formatting depending on settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and 5 together to apply strikethrough formatting to selected text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce strikethrough formatting. Useful for showing deletions or completed items.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Period together to format selected text as superscript for footnotes or exponents.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce superscript formatting when reading character attributes.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Comma together to format selected text as subscript for chemical formulas or mathematical notation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce subscript formatting when checking character properties.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Greater Than together to increase font size of selected text to next available size.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce new font size depending on settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Less Than together to decrease font size of selected text to next smaller size.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce reduced font size when format reporting enabled.

shortcuts.context: When text with formatting is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and C together to copy formatting from selected text for applying to other text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce formatting copied. Select destination text and paste formatting.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and V together to apply previously copied formatting to selected text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce formatting applied. Changes font, size, color, and other attributes.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Backslash together to remove all formatting from selected text returning it to default style.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce formatting cleared. Removes bold, italic, color, font changes, etc.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Zero together to apply Normal text paragraph style to current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce paragraph style changed to Normal text.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and 1 together to apply Heading 1 style to current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Heading 1 applied. Creates major section heading in document outline.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and 2 together to apply Heading 2 style to current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Heading 2 applied. Creates subsection heading.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and 3 together to apply Heading 3 style to current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Heading 3 applied. Creates sub-subsection heading.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and L together to align current paragraph or selected paragraphs to the left margin.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce left alignment applied when checking paragraph formatting.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and E together to center align current paragraph between left and right margins.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce center alignment when reading paragraph attributes.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and R together to align current paragraph or selected paragraphs to the right margin.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce right alignment in paragraph formatting.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and J together to justify paragraph aligning to both left and right margins.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce justified alignment. Adds spacing between words to fill line width.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Right Bracket together to increase indentation level of current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce indent level increased. Moves paragraph right.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Left Bracket together to decrease indentation level of current paragraph.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce indent level decreased. Moves paragraph left.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 7 together to convert current paragraph to numbered list item or toggle off.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce numbered list and item number. Creates sequential numbering.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 8 together to convert current paragraph to bulleted list item or toggle off.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bulleted list. Creates list with bullet markers.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in list item
shortcuts.description: Press Tab at the beginning of a list item to increase its nesting level creating a sub-list.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce list level increased. Creates nested sub-items.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in nested list item
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Tab at the beginning of a nested list item to decrease its level moving it up one level.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce list level decreased. Promotes item to parent level.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Z together to undo the last editing action or change made to the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce what action was undone depending on verbosity settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Y together to redo an action that was previously undone.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce redo action completion.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and X together to cut selected text removing it from document and placing on clipboard.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text cut to clipboard.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and C together to copy selected text to clipboard without removing from document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text copied to clipboard.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and V together to paste clipboard content at cursor position with original formatting.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce paste occurred. Formatting is preserved from source.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and V together to paste clipboard content as plain text without any formatting.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text pasted. Removes fonts, colors, styles from pasted content.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and A together to select all text and content in the entire document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce all content selected or report selection range.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F together to open find dialog for searching text within the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce find dialog and place focus in search field.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and H together to open Find and Replace dialog for searching and replacing text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog with find and replace fields. Tab between fields.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and G together to jump to the next occurrence of the current search term.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce match found and may read surrounding text.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and G together to jump to the previous occurrence of the search term.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous match found.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and P together to open print dialog for printing the document or saving as PDF.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce print dialog. Navigate options with Tab and select printer or PDF output.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and O together to open the file picker for selecting a document to open from Google Drive.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce file picker dialog. Navigate files with arrow keys and press Enter to open.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and S together to create a copy of the current document in Google Drive.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce copy dialog. Name the copy and choose location.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or cursor positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and M together to insert a comment on selected text or at cursor position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce comment box opened. Type comment text and press Ctrl+Enter to post.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is on commented text
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and A together to open comment thread at current cursor position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce comment thread opened. Read replies and add your own.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is on commented text
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and E together, release, then press C to enter and focus the current comment thread.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce comment focused. Navigate replies with arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and T together to insert a table at cursor position with dialog to specify size.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce table insertion dialog. Specify number of rows and columns.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Tab together to move to the previous cell in the table.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous cell position and content.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and H together to move cursor to the first cell in the current row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce first cell of row.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and K together to move cursor to the last cell in the current row.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce last cell of row.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and J together to move cursor to the first cell in the current column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce first cell of column.

shortcuts.context: When cursor is in table cell
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and L together to move cursor to the last cell in the current column.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce last cell of column.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and N together, release, then press T to jump to the next table in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce next table found and position.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and P together, release, then press T to jump to the previous table.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous table found.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected or cursor positioned
shortcuts.description: Press Control and K together to insert or edit a hyperlink on selected text or at cursor position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce link dialog opened. Enter URL and press Enter to apply.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and I together to open image insertion dialog for adding images from various sources.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce image dialog. Choose from upload, URL, Drive, Photos, or search.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Enter together to insert a page break at cursor position starting new page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page break inserted. Content after break moves to next page.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and Minus together to insert a horizontal line across the page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce horizontal line inserted. Visual separator for content sections.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and F together to insert a footnote at cursor position with auto-numbering.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce footnote inserted. Cursor moves to footnote area at bottom to type footnote text.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Equals together to insert mathematical equation using equation editor.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce equation editor opened. Type LaTeX or use equation tools.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Z together to enable screen reader support mode which optimizes Google Docs for screen readers.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce screen reader support enabled. Improves navigation and announces formatting changes more reliably.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and X together to have Google Docs read the selected text aloud using text-to-speech.
shortcuts.notes: Google Docs announces and begins reading selection. Uses built-in TTS, works alongside screen readers.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and H together to toggle braille support for refreshable braille displays.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce braille support enabled or disabled. Optimizes output for braille displays.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and A together, release, then press L to have Google Docs announce the current cursor location.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page number, line, and character position of cursor.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and A together, release, then press F to announce formatting at current cursor position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce font, size, bold, italic, color, and other formatting attributes.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and S together to activate voice typing for dictating text using microphone.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce voice typing started. Speak clearly to dictate text. Click microphone icon or press shortcut again to stop.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and S together to open share dialog for giving others access to the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce share dialog. Add email addresses and set permissions.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and H together to view document version history and restore previous versions.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce history panel opened. Navigate versions by date and author.
